summary: This document appears to be a series of text messages or chat logs from July 10, 2019, between staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, discussing inmate housing and psychological assessments. The messages specifically mention housing another inmate with Jeffrey Epstein and note that Epstein will need a psychological evaluation the following day for a crisis.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist U.S. Department of Justice/ Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.role: Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: The primary correspondent in the chat log, discussing inmate status, housing assignments, and psychological assessments.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as an inmate who will be housed with another individual and requires a psychological evaluation (POFU) for a crisis the following day.

events.title: Scheduled Psychological Evaluation for Epstein

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The communication occurred on July 10, 2019, between staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate at the facility and was to be housed with another inmate who was a former police officer frustrated with his legal case.
Epstein was scheduled for a psychological evaluation (POFU) on July 11, 2019, due to a crisis.
The document is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
